articles.title: US Urged to Make Decision to Replace AA by Peace Treaty
articles.content:
US Urged to Make Decision to Replace AA by Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The old armistice regime, a product of the Cold War, still persists on the Korean Peninsula, creating an instable situation of neither war nor peace. 
					 The protracted cease-fire on the peninsula, something  unprecedented in the world history of cease-fire is little short of  a time bomb posing constant threat to the security in East Asia and, furthermore, in the other regions of Asia-Pacific at present.
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty would mean the first step toward creating a peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 This is not the issue different from the issue of the denuclearization of the peninsula.
					
					 The settlement of the issue of establishing a peace-keeping regime would lead to automatically solving other matters guaranteeing the peace process on the peninsula.
					
					 In the past a series of discussions including the six-party talks for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula had been held for six years, undergoing up and down and repeated failures. As their course indicates, this was attributable not to the order of action but to their failure to properly settle the fundamental issue. 
					
					 It is the main purport and stand of the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty to build confidence to facilitate the denuclearization of the peninsula. 
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty would mark the beginning of confidence-building and provide an occasion of wiping out distrust between the DPRK and the U.S. and establishing the relations of bilateral respect and equality in its course.
					
					 Confidence-building serves as a main reason why the AA should be replaced by a peace treaty.
					
					 The U.S. should fulfill its historic responsibility in ensuring peace on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. has so far intervened in the Korean issue as a party directly responsible for the conclusion of the AA and established its military control over south Korea.
					
					 No one can replace the U.S. in replacing the AA by a peace treaty.
					
					  The U.S. had already clarified on several occasions its official stand neither to pose a military threat to the DPRK nor invade it and shown its readiness to conclude a peace accord. 
					
					 There is neither reason nor condition not to respond to the proposal for concluding a peace treaty replacing the present AA if the U.S. truly wants to coexist with the DPRK peacefully and wishes for peace of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK attaches very great importance to concluding a peace treaty.
					
					 This reflects the principled stand of the DPRK government to successfully solve all the problems arising in the relations between the DPRK and the U.S. including denuclearization and provide a sure guarantee for peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and, furthermore, in the rest of the world through the conclusion of a peace treaty. 
					
					 The issue of concluding a peace treaty will find a smooth solution only if the U.S. has a political will to properly assess the changed situation and the trend of development of history and make a bold switchover in its DPRK policy in line with its interests and the aspiration of the world peace-loving people. 
					
					 The satisfactory settlement of the issue of establishing a peace-keeping regime depends on the stands of the countries concerned.
					
					 It is in line with the interests of the countries concerned and the common interests of various countries in the Asia-Pacific region to protect peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty is neither a matter of one party giving benefits to the other party nor an issue of one party offering a reward to the other party but a fruitful political matter beneficial to the DPRK and the U.S. and the international community alike and substantially conducive to the preservation of the world peace. 
					
					 How to approach the proposed peace treaty will be a touchstone distinguishing between those who wish for lasting peace in the Asia-Pacific region including the Korean Peninsula and those opposed to it.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the present trend of history and the developing situation and make a decision to replace the AA by a peace treaty as early as possible.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Working Contact for KIZ Held
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Working Contact for KIZ Held
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- An inter-Korean working contact for revitalizing the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) took place in the zone from January 19 to 21.
					 Discussed there were the matters of improving and revitalizing the work of the KIZ for this year.
					
					 At the contact the north side recalled that it initiated the construction of the KIZ in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and has made sincere efforts to develop the zone. And it cited detailed data and examples to contend that such matters as laws and regulations on the KIZ, contract on lease of land, wages and taxation in the zone should be settled in conformity with international standards and the peculiarities and actual conditions of the zone.
					
					 But the south side ducked discussions over the important pending issues, including wage hike that requires urgent settlement for revitalizing the KIZ, and brought up side issues only to lay an obstacle to the contact.
					
					 The north side charged that the south side has viciously pursued the confrontation policy to seriously get on the former's nerves and is opposing even negotiations on the increase of wages for the workers in the KIZ, which are very paltry at present, while refusing to pay more under unreasonable pretexts of "financial resources" and the like. And it strongly urged the south side to sincerely approach discussions over the matters.
					
					 The south side persisted in its poor excuses and groundless assertions, unhesitatingly blaring it is the stand of its authorities that the matters of land prices and wages should never be included in the agenda items.
					
					 Such wrong attitude of the south side pushed the contact to the crisis of rupture.
					
					 The north side decided to give another chance to the south side now that it proposed to discuss the issue of wages at next contact, and agreed to have the next contact on February 1.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Yong Jun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Yong Jun
						
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Thursday sent a wreath to the bier of Labor Hero, People's Scientist, Academician, Professor and Doctor Kim Yong Jun who is a researcher of Kim Il Sung University, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Parliamentary Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Parliamentary Delegation
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday met and had a talk with the delegation of lawmakers from various political parties of Italy headed by Osvaldo Napoli, vice-president of the Parliamentary Group of the People Liberty of the Chamber of Deputies who is chairman of the Committee for the Development of Relations and Cooperation with the DPRK of the Parliament, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 The head of the delegation referred to the fact that the two countries have cooperated in several fields for the past decade since the establishment of diplomatic relations, adding Italy will make efforts to develop the relations with the DPRK in the future, too.

articles.title: National Meeting Held
articles.content:
National Meeting Held 
Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday to commemorate the 85th anniversary of the 1,000-ri journey for national liberation made by President Kim Il Sung and the 35th anniversary of the first study tour to trace its course organized by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Jung Rin, Kim Ki Nam and officials in the fields of preservation of revolutionary relics, education and media, officials of the youth league, members of the study tour group for tracing the course of the 1,000-ri journey for national liberation and school youth and children in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Il Sung set out on his 1,000-ri journey for national liberation on Jan. 22, Juche 14 (1925) with firm determination to liberate Korea true to the intention of his father, thus bringing the dawn of national resurrection to the country where the dark clouds hung under the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and giving origin to the sacred revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Il organized the study tour of the 1,000-ri journey for national liberation 35 years ago and has wisely led the work to bring up the school youth and children to be reliable revolutionary vanguard fighters who would steadily carry forward the march started on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, in a report said the President pioneered and led the revolutionary cause of Juche and adorned the modern history of the Korean people with heroic events and laudable victories, adding all these revolutionary activities originated in the 1,000-ri journey and all the achievements made in the revolution and construction as well as the praiseworthy life and happiness of the Korean people also started from the journey.
					
					Kim Jong Il saw to it that the study tour of the course is organized as a traditional work of the youth league and statues of the President in his teens are built at significant places, thus making sure that the 1,000-ri journey for revolution made by the President is glorified for all ages, he said, adding:
					
					 Immensely bright is the road ahead of the new generation who are marching forward holding high the red flag of the revolution associated with the whole life of Kim Il Sung. All the school youth and children should rally close around the headquarters of the revolution headed by Kim Jong Il in single mind and creditably fulfill their honorable missions and duties as the successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: 15th Paektusan Sports Contest Opens
articles.content:
15th Paektusan Sports Contest Opens
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The 15th sports contest of officials of national institutions for Paektusan Prize for commemorating February 16 was opened with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street Thursday.
					 Eleven events such as basketball, volleyball, table tennis, Taekwon-Do, shooting and seesaw will take place at the May Day Stadium, Taekwon-Do Hall and gymnasiums in Chongchun Street.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Vice-Premier Kwak Pom Gi, officials concerned, players and officials of ministries and national institutions.

articles.title: Korean Athletes Convinced of Good Scores
articles.content:
Korean Athletes Convinced of Good Scores
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Korean athletes have begun the new year's training, filled with confidence in their good results in international and local tournaments.
					 Last year sportspersons of the country registered good results in international arenas, delighting the local people, who were working hard to build a thriving nation.
					
					 The national team gained a ticket for the final games of the 2010 FIFA World Cup and players of wrestling, gymnastics, judo, weightlifting and other events proved successful at World and Asian Championships, East Asian Games and other international tournaments.   
					
					 The players and their coaches are now determined to further develop the country's sports technique and distinguish themselves in international tournaments this year, too. 
					
					 Kim Jong Hun, chief coach of the national male football team, told KCNA that his team would score a good result in the World Cup to live up to the expectation of the people by giving full play to the mental power of the players and coaches.
					
					 Olympic gold medalist Pak Hyon Suk, female weightlifter of the Amnokgang Sports Team, who was chosen as one of the ten top players of the country in 2008 and again in 2009, told KCNA that she will make redoubled efforts in training to exalt the honor of the country with gold medals.

articles.title: Field Medical Service Active
articles.content:
Field Medical Service Active
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Medical workers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have visited working sites from the outset of the year to give on-the-spot medical services to workers and peasants in the effort for implementing the tasks put forward in the joint New Year editorial, issued by leading newspapers of the country.
					 Doctors of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital and the Kim Man Yu Hospital are providing medical services to workers at such major light industry factories as the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill and the Pyongyang Textile Mill.
					
					 Such medical care has also been provided to rural communities including Oguk Co-op Farm in Anak County, South Hwanghae Province and Tongbong Co-op Farm in Hamju County, South Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Workers of metal, electric power and coal industries and rail transport are enjoying field medical services given by doctors of the Pyongyang University of Medicine Teaching Hospital, Pyongyang Ophthalmic Hospital and Ministry of Public Health Skin-disease Preventive Centre in cooperation with local hospitals and clinics.
					
					 The above-mentioned medical workers are also conducting hygienic propaganda activities on site and rendering a large amount of restorative tea, medicines and aid materials to working people.

articles.title: Spiritual Strength Fully Displayed
articles.content:
Spiritual Strength Fully Displayed
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial issued by leading newspapers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea called on all the servicepersons and civilians of the country to display their spiritual strength to the full for speeding up this year's general offensive.
					 In response to the call, they have launched efforts to bring about a greater victory this year in the spirit of having made tremendous achievements last year by dint of indomitable spiritual strength.
					
					 The service members who have created "Huichon speed", a new Chollima speed, in the construction of the Huichon Power Station, have worked hard in the cold to complete concrete tamping within a year to work a miracle in the history of dam construction, with the might of revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 The builders of Ryesonggang Youth Power Station No. 2 have fully displayed the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and hard working under the slogan "When the Party is determined, we can do anything!" As a result, the project is near completion now.
					
					 The rolling, ferroalloy and other shops of the Chollima Steel Complex have recorded remarkable successes every day in steel production.
					
					 The workers of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex have produced various kinds of forgings and materials needed for manufacture and repair of locomotives. They, with the help of technicians, have topped their daily assignments 120 percent.
					
					 The sectors of light industry and agriculture, major fronts of the efforts for improving the people's living standard, are seething with an upswing in production and farming preparations to let the people really enjoy benefits from socialism.
					
					The spiritual strength highly displayed among the Korean servicemen and people is unthinkable without General Secretary Kim Jong Il's strong will and spirit.
					
					 He kindled the flame of a new, great revolutionary upsurge and stirred up their mental power with his energetic and intensive field guidance over many units throughout the country last year. This year, too, in the teeth of bitter cold in January, he has continued the field guidance tour from the beginning of the year to inspire all the servicepersons and civilians in the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Songgang Exalts Might of Single-Minded Unity
articles.content:
Songgang Exalts Might of Single-Minded Unity
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il has placed the workers of the Songjin Steel Complex (Songgang), who have established a Juche-based steel-making system, in the van of a great revolutionary upsurge in the Songun era.
					 The indomitable mental power of the workers, performers of the great feat, has helped invigorate the campaign for a great revolutionary upsurge throughout the country.
					
					 They had also kindled the torch of Songgang with an indefatigable will in the period of the "Arduous March," the forced march.
					
					 In the period the Korean people were working in the worst conditions caused by the imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle the country and their economic blockade against it and by years of natural disasters.
					
					 Furnaces of the complex had not worked properly for the lack of electricity and raw and other materials.
					
					 At that time Kim Jong Il visited the complex. Saying steel industry was as important as ever in economic construction so that it should continue to be given priority, he called on the workers of the complex, who had upheld the Workers' Party of Korea with increased steel production whenever the country was in hard times, to stand in the van of a great upsurge by advancing at the speed of Chollima once again.
					
					 Encouraged by his call, they have brought out a radical boost in production by overcoming all difficulties in the revolutionary soldier spirit and even made a huge oxygen plant.
					
					 All the workers of the country, regarding the leader's confidence in the workers of the complex as just one in them, have made world-startling miracles and merits in production and construction.
					
					 All the achievements made by the Korean workers are a precious fruit of the single-minded unity between the leader and people.

articles.title: Fight against Imperialism Called for
articles.content:
Fight against Imperialism Called for 
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The world progressive people should look through the imperialists' vulnerability and inevitable downfall and firmly stand up against their threat and blackmail, Rodong Sinmun urges this in a signed article Thursday.
					 It is the strategic goal of the imperialists to stamp out the anti-imperialist and independent forces by threatening and blackmailing them and thus make the world a unipolar world dominated by them, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 One who is caught in the imperialists' threat and blackmail tactics is bound to take to national nihilism, think of one's own destiny before the one of the country and the nation and subsequently betray them for the sake of one's own indolence and happiness.
					
					 One will end up in losing the dignity of the nation and sovereignty of the country and gaining the miserable fate of subordinate and slave in consequence of treachery and surrender.
					
					 Firmly standing up against the imperialists' threat and blackmail provides a fundamental guarantee for victory.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have carried out socialist construction in direct stand-off with the strong imperialist enemies for a long time and thus always won victories in the acute confrontation with the enemies under the banner of Songun.
					
					 The DPRK will always emerge victorious in the confrontation with imperialists and in the drive for defending socialism as it holds the peerless Songun commander in high esteem and has the people with strong mental power and the invincible army.
					
					 It is a bitter lesson taught by the prevailing situation that one who firmly stands up against the imperialists' threat and blackmail is sure to triumph but one who yields to them to go to ruin.

articles.title: Movement for Solidarity Called for
articles.content:
Movement for Solidarity Called for
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, issued a statement on Jan. 14 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the leading newspapers of the DPRK.
					 He in the statement noted that the year 2010, the 65th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea, is a year of great significance in glorifying the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung in the party construction and the cause of building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					The year 2010 marks the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of his Songun revolutionary leadership and the 10th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, he said, adding:
					
					 The reunification of the Korean Peninsula should be achieved by the concerted efforts of the north and the south of Korea as it was divided into two parts due to the wild ambition of the U.S. imperialists to dominate the world and their moves for aggression.
					
					 The historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration serves as a banner for great national unity.
					
					 The joint New Year editorial published in the DPRK encourages the Peruvian people in their struggle to get rid of the tentacles of imperialism. 
					
					 The people's front fully supports the joint editorial published by the leading newspapers of the DPRK on the occasion of the New Year and will conduct a more dynamic movement for solidarity with the heroic Korean people.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Supported
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Supported
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union made public a statement and the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, the All India Agricultural Workers' Union, the All India Peasants' Union and the All India Federation of Lawyers and the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Finland-Korea Society released joint statements in support of the statement of the DPRK Foreign Ministry on January 15.
					 The Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in its statement said that the proposal of the DPRK for an early start of the talks of the parties to the Korean Armistice Agreement for replacing it by a peace treaty for the normal situation on the Korean Peninsula would be a good start for the resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					 It is time for the above-said parties to lend their ears to the reasonable proposal of the DPRK government and sit at a negotiating table to put their commitments into practice, the statement said, adding that this is the best way for settling the issue of the Korean Peninsula which has long remained unsettled, beset with unpredictable consequences.
					
					 The above-said organizations of India in a joint statement expressed belief that the DPRK proposal to have talks for concluding a peace treaty would contribute to ensuring peace on the peninsula and realizing its denuclearization and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, demanding the U.S. sincerely accept the proposal and immediately come out to the proposed talks.
					
					 The above-mentioned organizations of Finland in their joint statement reiterated their support to the DPRK proposal for concluding a peace treaty, noting that it is an important matter to be settled first of all for the purpose of achieving the reunification of Korea and peace and security in the area of Northeast Asia to conclude a peace treaty and put an end to the U.S. presence in south Korea.

articles.title: DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Egypt
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Egypt
 Pyongyang, January 21 (KCNA) -- The Egyptian preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was inaugurated in Cairo on Jan. 15.
					 Youssef Amin Wali, vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					The preparatory committee set the period from Jan. 15 to April 16 as a period of commemorations and decided to hold diverse political and cultural events such as seminars on works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, Korean book and photo exhibitions and film shows in this period.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Kim Yong Jun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Kim Yong Jun
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 21 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Yong Jun, investigador de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, quien era Heroe del Trabajo, Cientifico del Pueblo, Academico, Profesor y Doctor Titulares, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Efectuado contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para revitalizar la ZIK
articles.content:
Efectuado contacto de trabajo Norte-Sur para revitalizar la ZIK
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 19 al 21 en la Zona Industrial de Kaesong (ZIK) el contacto de trabajo entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea para revitalizar la ZIK.
					En la ocasion, fueron debatidos los problemas para mejorar y dinamizar las labores de esa zona en continuidad al ano pasado.
					
					Nuestra parte recordo que habia tomado la iniciativa de construir la ZIK segun el espiritu de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y se ha esforzado sinceramente por desarrollarla.
					
					Seguidamente, insistio citando datos y ejemplos concretos en que el reglamento y el contrato de arrendamiento de la tierra de la ZIK, el salario, el impuesto y otros problemas deben ser resueltos conforme a las normas internacionales, las peculiaridades y las condiciones reales de la zona.
					
					Sin embargo, la parte Sur obstaculizo artificialmente el contacto eludiendo debatir los problemas pendientes importantes, inclusive el aumento de salario, que urgen ser solucionados para revitalizar la ZIK, y planteando asuntos insignificantes.
					
					La parte Norte refuto a la contraparte, que al perseguir persistentemente la politica de confrontacion, irrito seriamente a aquella y rehusa las mismas negociaciones diciendo que no puede pagar el salario de los trabajadores de la ZIK, que no cubre los gastos menudos, describiendolo absurdamente como "fuente de mucho ingreso". Y le exigio fuertemente a la parte Sur que proceda con sinceridad al debate de los problemas.
					
					Recurriendo de continuo a los subterfugios prolijos y a las insistencias absurdas, la parte Sur solto sin vacilacion alguna hasta el disparate de que no incluir en la agenda el arriendo de la tierra y el problema de salario es la posicion de sus autoridades.
					
					Debido a la injusta actitud de la parte Sur, el contacto de trabajo llego hasta a la crisis de ruptura.
					
					Con la intencion de darle un chance mas a la parte Sur, la parte Norte dio su consentimiento en contactarse de nuevo el primero de febrero, ya que aquella prometio discutir el problema de salario en el proximo contacto.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fundicion de Hungnam y empresas pesqueras
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fundicion de Hungnam y empresas pesqueras
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Fundicion de Metales No Ferrosos de Hungnam, la Empresa Pesquera Taehung de Hungnam y la Empresa Pesquera de Sojung.
					El Dirigente estuvo primero en la Fundicion de Metales No Ferrosos de Hungnam.
					
					Se entero en detalles del estado de reconstruccion tecnica y produccion recorriendo el taller de aleacion dura y otros procesos de produccion.
					
					Al ver los productos de buena calidad que salen en cadena de los procesos productivos dotados de equipos modernos, aprecio mucho los orgullosos meritos de los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de la fundicion poniendose muy contento de que ellos hayan sentado la firme base material y tecnica y normalizado en el alto nivel la produccion mediante el impulso dinamico de la reconstruccion tecnica con las fuerzas y tecnologias propias.
					
					Senalo que al resolver con satisfaccion numerosos problemas cientifico-tecnicos prestando primordial atencion a la revolucion tecnica segun la demanda de la idea del partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y tecnica y librar intensamente la lucha por la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de los procesos productivos, la fundicion pudo registrar un cambio trascendental en la produccion de metales no ferrosos.
					
					Subrayo que este gran cambio brillante comprueba otra vez que la clave del incremento de la produccion reside en el progreso tecnico.
					
					Esta fundicion ocupa un importante lugar en el desarrollo economico del pais, enseno y presento las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante esta empresa.
					
					Subrayo que la tarea mas importante de ella es normalizar la produccion en el alto nivel y asentar todos los procesos productivos sobre la base cientifico-tecnica mas elevada concentrando de continuo las fuerzas en la reconstruccion tecnica.
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente oriento las labores de la Empresa Pesquera Taehung de Hungnam.
					
					Recorriendo durante largo tiempo los procesos productivos incluyendo el taller de espumante plastico y los productos maritimos elaborados de distintos tipos, hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion.
					
					Evaluo altamente los meritos de los funcionarios, los obreros y los tecnicos de la empresa mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos hayan aumentado sistematicamente la produccion de pescados realizando por cuenta propia la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de los barcos y otros equipos pesqueros y renovado radicalmente la fisonomia de la empresa acondicionando hermosamente el Centro de Servicios Publicos Unjongwon, el sanatorio y otras instalaciones de cultura y servicios publicos. 
					
					La Empresa Pesquera Taehung de Hungnam ocupa una posicion importante en la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo, dijo e indico las tareas que incumben a ella. 
					
					  Para aumentar la produccion y el procesamiento de pescados hay que pescar mucho mas peces con diversos metodos mediante la universalizacion de los barcos de pesca y elevar la tasa de funcionamiento de los equipos procesadores haciendo mas eficientes la administracion tecnica y el cuidado de equipos, enseno.
					
					  Agrego que para pescar de acuerdo con las cambiadas condiciones de este trabajo, es preciso establecer mas estrictamente el cientifico sistema de pesca e impulsar con vistas al futuro la exploracion de nuevas zonas de pesca. 
					
					  Fijo la meta de produccion de pescados que debe alcanzar la empresa en unos anos cercanos, y recalco que la empresa debe conquistarla a toda costa para suministrar mucho mas pescados al pueblo. 
					
					  Nuestro pais rodeado por el mar en sus tres lados tiene condiciones geofisicas favorables para desarrollar la industria pesquera y por lo tanto, se debe prestar profunda atencion a esta labor, subrayo e ilumino el rumbo y los remedios para el respecto. 
					
					  Seguidamente, el Dirigente visito la Empresa Pesquera de Sojung. 
					
					Recorrio los tanques de cria, el desembarcadero y otros lugares de la empresa, averiguando concretamente el estado de produccion y de conservacion de pescados. 
					
					Si aumentan la produccion de pescados y, al mismo tiempo y crian por algun tiempo los peces en los tanques antes de suministrarlos al pueblo, como hace esta empresa, el pueblo puede consumir siempre peces frescos aleteando, dijo el Dirigente y presento las tareas para acondicionar bien los equipos de cria y cientifizar su gestion. 
					
					  La poderosa industria pesada de nuestro pais, incluso la metalurgica, comienza a manifestar su poderio y, como resultado, se abrio la ancha brecha para lograr el desarrollo vertiginoso de la industria ligera, la agricultura y la pesquera, destaco el Dirigente y exhorto encarecidamente a registrar un gran salto en todos los sectores de la economia nacional para glorificar este ano historico como ano de cambio decisivo en la vida del pueblo. 
					
					  Le acompanaron el secretario responsable del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Thae Jong Su, y la jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui.

articles.title: Efectuada primera reunion de junta de directores del GIITC
articles.content:
Efectuada primera reunion de junta de directores del GIITC
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 20 en el Hotel Internacional Yanggakdo la primera reunion de la junta de directores del Grupo de Inversion Internacional Taepung de Corea (GIITC).
					  A la cita asistieron los directores de dicho grupo y los funcionarios correspondientes como observadores.
					
					  Se dio lectura a la orden del Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea: "Sobre el aseguramiento de las actividades del Grupo de Inversion Internacional Taepung de Corea".
					
					  Tambien, fueron transmitidas las resoluciones del CDN: "Sobre la fundacion del Banco Nacional para el Desarrollo" y "Sobre la organizacion del comite coordinador del Grupo de Inversion Internacional Taepung de Corea".
					
					  Como director general de la junta del grupo fue elegido Kim Yang Gon, presidente del Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico.
					
					El coreano residente en China Pak Chol Su fue electo como subdirector general permanente y presidente de la misma junta.
					
					  Esta se compone de 7 personas incluyendo los representantes del CDN de la RPDC, el Consejo de Ministros, el Ministerio de Finanzas, una oficina interesada, el CCPAP y del GIITC. 
					
					La reunion resolvio instalar el secretariado y nomino a sus miembros.
					
					   Tambien analizo y decidio los puntos de la agenda sobre la labor del GIITC, incluyendo el borrador de su estatuto, el plan de trabajo y el proyecto presupuestario financiero del GIITC para 2010 y la resolucion sobre el funcionamiento del comite preparatorio de la fundacion del Banco Nacional para el Desarrollo.
					
					El informe de base estuvo a cargo de Kim Yang Gon y Pak Chol Su pronuncio un discurso sobre el trabajo del GIITC.
					
					El GIITC, organo de cooperacion economica con el extranjero actuara como complejo economico encargado de asegurar la induccion de inversiones y las fuentes de fondos para el Banco Nacional para el Desarrollo y su sede se establecera en Pyongyang.
					
					Ese banco cumplira las gestiones de inversion en los proyectos importantes segun la politica estatal con la norma y el sistema financieros modernos que permitiran negociar con las Instituciones Financieras Internacionales y bancos comerciales internacionales.

articles.title: Acto central por aniversarios de "camino de mil ri para restauracion"
articles.content:
Acto central por aniversarios de "camino de mil ri para restauracion"
Pyongyang, 21 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 21 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto central por el 85o aniversario del "camino de mil ri (400 kilometros) para la restauracion" recorrido por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el 35o de la primera peregrinacion por el mismo camino organizada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Asistieron a la ocasion Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Jung Rin, Kim Ki Nam, los funcionarios de las ramas de conservacion de reliquias historicas revolucionarias, educacion, prensa e informacion y de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, los miembros de la caravana de recorrido del "camino de mil ri para la restauracion", jovenes y ninos escolares de esta capital.
					
					El 22 de enero del 14 (1925) de la Era Juche, el Presidente emprendio el "camino de mil ri para la restauracion" con la heroica decision de lograr la independencia de Corea en acato al proposito de su padre, de modo que despuntara la aurora de renacimiento nacional en la tierra patria colonizada entonces por el imperialismo japones y se diera inicio a la sagrada causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					El Dirigente organizo hace ahora 35 anos la primera peregrinacion por el "camino de mil ri para la restauracion" y condujo sabiamente la labor para formar a los jovenes y ninos escolares como fidedignos combatientes vanguardistas de la revolucion que continuen firmemente la marcha del Paektu. 
					
					El primer secretario del CC de la UJS, Ri Yong Chol, en el informe de la ocasion senalo que comenzaron con el "camino de mil ri para la restauracion" las actividades revolucionarias del Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien vino coronando la historia contemporanea del pueblo coreano con los eventos heroicos y orgullosas victorias conduciendo al frente la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada por si mismo, y provinieron de esa ruta todos los exitos logrados en la revolucion y la construccion, la digna vida y felicidad del pueblo coreano. 
					
					Subrayo que el Dirigente hizo organizar el recorrido como la labor tradicional de la UJS y glorificar eternamente ese camino de la revolucion recorrido por el Presidente mediante la edificacion de las estatuas de bronce de este en su infancia y juventud en los lugares significativos.
					
					Es muy radiante y prometedor el porvenir de las nuevas generaciones que marchan adelante enarbolando la bandera roja de la revolucion en que esta reflejada toda la vida del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, apunto y destaco que todos los jovenes y ninos deben cumplir magnificamente su honrosa mision y deber de continuadores de la causa revolucionaria del Juche uniendose firmemente con la misma voluntad y el mismo proposito en torno a la Direccion de la Revolucion encabezada por el Dirigente.
